oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Paid by the Procedure: A Professional Approach to Veterinary Fees
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hagerman, D. C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: services
fair fee
professional fee
Paid by the Procedure
veterinary practice
practice tips
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: What is one of the most difficult tasks we have to perform as large animal practitioners? Is it correcting a uterine prolapse? How about treating a client's best cow for acute watery mastitis? Or having to recommend euthanasia for a cow with a fractured pelvis? Although all of these are equally difficult, I believe one of the most arduous tasks we face as professionals is charging a fair fee for our services. Gone are the days of an annual billing. The one line ticket of "Visit Cow - $35.00" is also a thing of the past. To determine a professional fee that is fair and equitable to both parties, I have found being "Paid by the Procedure" most satisfactory.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1988; 167-171
